snippet: While the auto industry over all improved by 3 percent in initial quality, South Korean automakers improved by 11 percent, the J.D. Power study showed.
abstract: JD Power study finds that South Korean automakers are quickly closing longstanding quality gap with their international competitors; quality study ranks Kia second and Hyundai fourth; nation's car makers improve by overall rate of 11 percent, in comparison with average improvement of 3 percent.
lead_paragraph: While the auto industry over all improved by 3 percent in initial quality, South Korean automakers improved by 11 percent, the J.D. Power study showed.

headline.main: Kia and Hyundai Show Improvement in J.D. Power Quality Study
headline.print_headline: J.D. Power Quality Study Shows South Korean Automakers Gaining Ground Fast
